title: uShapp Shoes Treatment Web
lead: uShapp shoescare is a website that was built to accommodate all information originating from the shoe washing service business.

text.content: The Engine, a Cambridge-based venture fund, was looking for a creative way to showcase the companies and founders that work at their new headquarters, as well as the problems they are solving. They tasked Sosolimited

text.content: to create a content-driven digitally-rendered artwork that would position The Engine and Tough Tech beyond the walls of the new headquarters, and express the transformative significance of the problems being tackled by the founders and their companies.

text.content: Our challenge was to create an application that highlighted The Engine’s brand and design principles while accepting various types of data input and edge cases, so that the artwork could best represent all of the activities at The Engine.

text.content: A quick visualization of the system architecture, and where the data comes from.

caption.plain_text: A quick visualization of the system architecture, and where the data comes from.

text.content: Data for the visualizations came from multiple sources. Core content such as companies, key themes, and statistics were delivered using GraphQL via Contentful. Real-time feeds such as Twitter and website articles were passed through a custom-built data service architecture that provided a layer of standardization and caching, whilst also implementing additional search and filter logic and bypassing CORS restrictions. A Slack bot was built for an internal channel, to monitor latest news articles and surface them on the wall.

rich_text.plain_text: Data for the visualizations came from multiple sources. Core content such as companies, key themes, and statistics were delivered using GraphQL via Contentful. Real-time feeds such as Twitter and website articles were passed through a custom-built data service architecture that provided a layer of standardization and caching, whilst also implementing additional search and filter logic and bypassing CORS restrictions. A Slack bot was built for an internal channel, to monitor latest news articles and surface them on the wall.

text.content: Problems that companies in The Engine face, and how they plan to solve them.

caption.plain_text: Problems that companies in The Engine face, and how they plan to solve them.

text.content: The end product was an innovative and sophisticated content-driven artwork that successfully positioned The Engine and Tough Tech beyond the walls of the new headquarters, and expressed the transformative significance of the problems that founders and their companies are tackling. The application was designed to engage audiences at hosted and public events, the general community, and to investors across the capital stack as well as strategic partners.

title: Bananabyte.id Web
lead: This project was created to complete my plans with my colleagues in creating website development services.

text.content: MIT Illuminations is an ongoing experiment in creative computation at the MIT Welcome Center. The lights dynamically illuminating the center are, like the MIT community, colorful, ever-changing, and alive. They were inspired by a long history of the MIT community deploying creative installations of colorful lights in dormitories, on bridges and buildings, and around campus.

rich_text.plain_text: MIT Illuminations is an ongoing experiment in creative computation at the MIT Welcome Center. The lights dynamically illuminating the center are, like the MIT community, colorful, ever-changing, and alive. They were inspired by a long history of the MIT community deploying creative installations of colorful lights in dormitories, on bridges and buildings, and around campus.

text.content: My role in the project, working with Sosolimited, was to build a desktop application that could communicate with the lights over UDP

rich_text.plain_text: My role in the project, working with Sosolimited, was to build a desktop application that could communicate with the lights over UDP

text.content: (kiNET)

rich_text.plain_text: (kiNET)

text.content: and make programming new shows a breeze from those learning and exploring creative coding. I worked to streamline portions of the user interface, incorporate an audio API that allows of audio input when creating shows, and overhauled the logic under-the-hood in terms of how P5.js operates within the context of the application.

rich_text.plain_text: and make programming new shows a breeze from those learning and exploring creative coding. I worked to streamline portions of the user interface, incorporate an audio API that allows of audio input when creating shows, and overhauled the logic under-the-hood in terms of how P5.js operates within the context of the application.

text.content: The UI supports real-time visualization of P5 code, including a preview with realistic light falloff.

caption.plain_text: The UI supports real-time visualization of P5 code, including a preview with realistic light falloff.

text.content: Over time this role expanded to building an open source version of the application that also supported sending lighting data to an Arduino, using a serial port connection. This open source version had to support both Windows and Mac, and have extensive error handling built in, validating user-defined P5.js code as it’s written and providing contextual hints and support.

rich_text.plain_text: Over time this role expanded to building an open source version of the application that also supported sending lighting data to an Arduino, using a serial port connection. This open source version had to support both Windows and Mac, and have extensive error handling built in, validating user-defined P5.js code as it’s written and providing contextual hints and support.

text.content: With that came the need for more extensive settings, allowing the application to be used in many contexts, with and without lights physically connected. Using Electron made deploying and updating the package on end-user machines streamlined, although serious configuration considerations had to be made to support the native serial port bindings.

title: Three Method DSS Web
lead: This system can make decisions or recommendations based on alternatives that have been inputted along with predetermined criteria.

text.content: ABM builds solutions to keep distribution running smoothly. White Rhino and myself were asked to put together a 3D experience showing their wide range of services, that provided for interaction and intrigue, and to make sure it could be deployed on tablet devices for an upcoming tradeshow.

rich_text.plain_text: ABM builds solutions to keep distribution running smoothly. White Rhino and myself were asked to put together a 3D experience showing their wide range of services, that provided for interaction and intrigue, and to make sure it could be deployed on tablet devices for an upcoming tradeshow.

text.content: The warehouse scene was the first scene we prototyped.

caption.plain_text: The warehouse scene was the first scene we prototyped.

text.content: Experience ABM was an interesting project from the start due to the time crunch of needing to get this live before a tradeshow, and the limitations of needing it to work on tablet devices. While the White Rhino team worked on the CodeIgniter backend and setting up the 2D interface elements, I got to work developing a webGL 3D experience that the user could navigate through by clicking on relevant hotspots.

rich_text.plain_text: Experience ABM was an interesting project from the start due to the time crunch of needing to get this live before a tradeshow, and the limitations of needing it to work on tablet devices. While the White Rhino team worked on the CodeIgniter backend and setting up the 2D interface elements, I got to work developing a webGL 3D experience that the user could navigate through by clicking on relevant hotspots.

text.content: Each hotspot focuses on an area of improvement that ABM helps companies achieve within their distribution centers, and when clicked would trigger additional information about that particular service. The hotspots were built as 3D elements in the scene, allowing them to be occluded by geometry. A raycaster from the camera determined hover events, whereas they triggered modal counterparts in the regular DOM when clicked.

rich_text.plain_text: Each hotspot focuses on an area of improvement that ABM helps companies achieve within their distribution centers, and when clicked would trigger additional information about that particular service. The hotspots were built as 3D elements in the scene, allowing them to be occluded by geometry. A raycaster from the camera determined hover events, whereas they triggered modal counterparts in the regular DOM when clicked.

text.content: A view of the warehouse glTF model, with it’s various nodes.

caption.plain_text: A view of the warehouse glTF model, with it’s various nodes.

text.content: The experience used Three.js and custom-built GLTF models for each scene. I implemented dynamic camera positioning logic with smooth animations from hotspot-to-hotspot using GSAP, plus a full render engine to correctly light the scene and provide for realistic shadows, ambient occlusion, and global illumination. Soft-shadows and tone mapping helped to sell a level of realism that would otherwise be difficult to achieve in real-time.

rich_text.plain_text: The experience used Three.js and custom-built GLTF models for each scene. I implemented dynamic camera positioning logic with smooth animations from hotspot-to-hotspot using GSAP, plus a full render engine to correctly light the scene and provide for realistic shadows, ambient occlusion, and global illumination. Soft-shadows and tone mapping helped to sell a level of realism that would otherwise be difficult to achieve in real-time.

text.content: A significant amount of work went into performance enhancements, treading the fine line between a photorealistic scene and one that renders quickly across multiple devices - especially as the primary deployment was on touchscreen kiosks at a tradeshow with less-than-optimal GPUs.

rich_text.plain_text: A significant amount of work went into performance enhancements, treading the fine line between a photorealistic scene and one that renders quickly across multiple devices - especially as the primary deployment was on touchscreen kiosks at a tradeshow with less-than-optimal GPUs.

text.content: The breakroom scene, with a few hotspots and the “scene selector wheel” at the bottom.

caption.plain_text: The breakroom scene, with a few hotspots and the “scene selector wheel” at the bottom.

text.content: The end product was a high-performing touchscreen experience that was cross-browser and cross-device friendly, and optimized for their digital marketing efforts with built-in lead capture forms and calls-to-action.

rich_text.plain_text: The end product was a high-performing touchscreen experience that was cross-browser and cross-device friendly, and optimized for their digital marketing efforts with built-in lead capture forms and calls-to-action.

text.content: To ensure we provided compatibility with older devices, we ultimately made 2D variations of each scene using a draggable environment mapped onto the inside of a sphere. This also helped at the tradeshow where mobile data was particularly slow; as significantly less data needed to be downloaded before the experience could run.

rich_text.plain_text: To ensure we provided compatibility with older devices, we ultimately made 2D variations of each scene using a draggable environment mapped onto the inside of a sphere. This also helped at the tradeshow where mobile data was particularly slow; as significantly less data needed to be downloaded before the experience could run.

text.content: Someone didn’t clean up the conference room.

caption.plain_text: Someone didn’t clean up the conference room.

text.content: Configuration of the software was simplified into a repeatable process, with a folder structure that ensured all 3D models/textures were available to the front-end, and XML files used to determine hotspot positioning, copy, icons, etc. The front-end code ingested these files and dynamically rendered the scene from them, so that less had to be hard-coded for each scene.

rich_text.plain_text: Configuration of the software was simplified into a repeatable process, with a folder structure that ensured all 3D models/textures were available to the front-end, and XML files used to determine hotspot positioning, copy, icons, etc. The front-end code ingested these files and dynamically rendered the scene from them, so that less had to be hard-coded for each scene.

text.content: An example of graceful fallbacks, the bathroom here is rendered without reflections in the mirrors on a lower-performing device.

caption.plain_text: An example of graceful fallbacks, the bathroom here is rendered without reflections in the mirrors on a lower-performing device.

text.content: Ah yes, generic soda machines, my favorite.

caption.plain_text: Ah yes, generic soda machines, my favorite.

text.content: It's looking really great! Thank you for all of your work, I appreciate your putting thought and care into building this correctly from the get-go.

rich_text.plain_text: It's looking really great! Thank you for all of your work, I appreciate your putting thought and care into building this correctly from the get-go.

title: Students Activity Monitoring
lead: This project created to detecting students who are carrying out field practice.

text.content: Deerfield is an investment management company with a focus on healthcare - with hundreds of articles on their website for visitors to browse and discover. The challenge that presented itself was how visitors would find content, and how to display it to promote discovery. The user experience had to guide users towards key content, while also keeping it well organized and fluid enough that you could explore in many different ways.

rich_text.plain_text: Deerfield is an investment management company with a focus on healthcare - with hundreds of articles on their website for visitors to browse and discover. The challenge that presented itself was how visitors would find content, and how to display it to promote discovery. The user experience had to guide users towards key content, while also keeping it well organized and fluid enough that you could explore in many different ways.

text.content: This project entailed taking an agency's design files and working alongside them to develop a reactive component that was visually interesting, while also performing well across a multitude of device capabilities.

rich_text.plain_text: This project entailed taking an agency's design files and working alongside them to develop a reactive component that was visually interesting, while also performing well across a multitude of device capabilities.

text.content: As you’d expect, a bunch of math went into place to calculate where each dot would land, and how they animate across the screen. HTML5 canvas was used to render the layer, with hit tests that trigger modal pop-ups surfacing more details on each content item.

rich_text.plain_text: As you’d expect, a bunch of math went into place to calculate where each dot would land, and how they animate across the screen. HTML5 canvas was used to render the layer, with hit tests that trigger modal pop-ups surfacing more details on each content item.

text.content: Content was drawn to the screen in concentric rings, with each dot representing a single content item. These items were color-coded into one of three categories, and their distance to the center of the diagram

rich_text.plain_text: Content was drawn to the screen in concentric rings, with each dot representing a single content item. These items were color-coded into one of three categories, and their distance to the center of the diagram

text.content: (and the brightness of the hotspot)

rich_text.plain_text: (and the brightness of the hotspot)

text.content: was determine based on the content’s relevance.

rich_text.plain_text: was determine based on the content’s relevance.

text.content: When a search term is entered, content animates into a new concentric circle.

caption.plain_text: When a search term is entered, content animates into a new concentric circle.

text.content: This functionality was extended into the search feature. When a user enters a search term, or clicks on one of the three main categories of content, the network will re-arrange and filter itself to show the most appropriate content front-and-center. Search itself was implemented using SwiftType.

rich_text.plain_text: This functionality was extended into the search feature. When a user enters a search term, or clicks on one of the three main categories of content, the network will re-arrange and filter itself to show the most appropriate content front-and-center. Search itself was implemented using SwiftType.

text.content: On the initial load, we wanted a full introduction animation before the network comes together to form their core values. This process involved not only working to simultaneously load data and swap out psuedo-elements, but a custom SVG filter was developed with some clever trickery to allow the dots to "blob" together when near each other, creative an intriguing fluid effect.

rich_text.plain_text: On the initial load, we wanted a full introduction animation before the network comes together to form their core values. This process involved not only working to simultaneously load data and swap out psuedo-elements, but a custom SVG filter was developed with some clever trickery to allow the dots to "blob" together when near each other, creative an intriguing fluid effect.

text.content: Performance was key, so the experience was extensively tested on a variety of mobile devices. We were constantly checking frame rate, animation speeds, hit boxes, and more to ensure a consistent and enjoyable browsing experience.

rich_text.plain_text: Performance was key, so the experience was extensively tested on a variety of mobile devices. We were constantly checking frame rate, animation speeds, hit boxes, and more to ensure a consistent and enjoyable browsing experience.

text.content: The final component provided for a robust and navigable user experience that allowed visitors to quickly find what was relevant to them. By implementing this system, Deerfield has improved the overall user experience for their visitors and increased the discoverability of their content.

rich_text.plain_text: The final component provided for a robust and navigable user experience that allowed visitors to quickly find what was relevant to them. By implementing this system, Deerfield has improved the overall user experience for their visitors and increased the discoverability of their content.

title: LaCinema Database & UI Design
lead: This project is a ticket booking based on MySQL language.

text.content: In 2020 I was part of a creative development project that built a prototype web experience to support consultative and customer-centric conversations between a business and its customers. The prototype was designed to unify the business story across horizontals and verticals and to allow salespeople to explore real business challenges that their customers were facing.

rich_text.plain_text: In 2020 I was part of a creative development project that built a prototype web experience to support consultative and customer-centric conversations between a business and its customers. The prototype was designed to unify the business story across horizontals and verticals and to allow salespeople to explore real business challenges that their customers were facing.

text.content: As you zoom into the experience, workflow hints surface around the edges of parent nodes.

caption.plain_text: As you zoom into the experience, workflow hints surface around the edges of parent nodes.

text.content: The goal of the prototype was to create a visual map of the business ecosystem that would convey its power and impact on businesses that use it. This visual, interactive combined workflow mapper and solution playbook was designed to be dynamic and to grow with the expanding catalog of service offerings and target markets.

rich_text.plain_text: The goal of the prototype was to create a visual map of the business ecosystem that would convey its power and impact on businesses that use it. This visual, interactive combined workflow mapper and solution playbook was designed to be dynamic and to grow with the expanding catalog of service offerings and target markets.

text.content: It featured fluid level-based navigation to easily handle non-linear conversations and paths, zooming and flying in through various workflows - facilitating exploration. It was designed to connect the dots on all service offerings available, even if they weren't immediately related to the customer's current needs. This was intended to solve a problem of lack of awareness when it came to the client’s expanded offerings, opening the door to extended conversations that focused on more than just what they needed “right now”. It used spacial organization to reveal connections based on customer profile, challenges, industry, market, interests and promotional initiatives. Finally, it easily surfaced applicable case studies and product demos when getting down to the solution level.

rich_text.plain_text: It featured fluid level-based navigation to easily handle non-linear conversations and paths, zooming and flying in through various workflows - facilitating exploration. It was designed to connect the dots on all service offerings available, even if they weren't immediately related to the customer's current needs. This was intended to solve a problem of lack of awareness when it came to the client’s expanded offerings, opening the door to extended conversations that focused on more than just what they needed “right now”. It used spacial organization to reveal connections based on customer profile, challenges, industry, market, interests and promotional initiatives. Finally, it easily surfaced applicable case studies and product demos when getting down to the solution level.

text.content: This simple workflow shows node-to-node connections in action.

caption.plain_text: This simple workflow shows node-to-node connections in action.

text.content: My role on the project was lead creative developer, handling the architecture and visual representation of the “graph” system. The application was built in Vue for browser-based usage duration presentational meetings. The development process took place in several sprints, from concepting/prototyping to design treatments and production development. I had the pleasure of working alongside Sosolimited in Boston to bring this one to life.

rich_text.plain_text: My role on the project was lead creative developer, handling the architecture and visual representation of the “graph” system. The application was built in Vue for browser-based usage duration presentational meetings. The development process took place in several sprints, from concepting/prototyping to design treatments and production development. I had the pleasure of working alongside Sosolimited in Boston to bring this one to life.

text.content: The frontend was a Vue application, with a major dividing line structurally between the main "graph" experience and the supporting UI chrome,  allowing for a separation of concerns between multiple developers without constant merge conflicts.

rich_text.plain_text: The frontend was a Vue application, with a major dividing line structurally between the main "graph" experience and the supporting UI chrome,  allowing for a separation of concerns between multiple developers without constant merge conflicts.

text.content: To enable easy configuration and content management, Contentful was selected.

caption.plain_text: To enable easy configuration and content management, Contentful was selected.

text.content: The backend was built with Express, with the goal of providing a simple and stable JSON API in front of a content management system

rich_text.plain_text: The backend was built with Express, with the goal of providing a simple and stable JSON API in front of a content management system

text.content: (Contentful)

rich_text.plain_text: (Contentful)

text.content: . The devOps for staging and testing ran on Heroku.

rich_text.plain_text: . The devOps for staging and testing ran on Heroku.

text.content: Within the Vue application, I built a workflow system that used a virtual 2D camera and calculated for various levels of 3D depth and focal points alongside art-directable offsets. Additionally, I built automatic diagramming that drew connection lines between associated nodes and animated them on, adding arrow heads and understanding the context of each target node’s anchor point. Lastly, I attached local assets that matched up with a database so that users could select any one of the available assets within the tool, including icons, PDFs, case studies, demo videos and more.

rich_text.plain_text: Within the Vue application, I built a workflow system that used a virtual 2D camera and calculated for various levels of 3D depth and focal points alongside art-directable offsets. Additionally, I built automatic diagramming that drew connection lines between associated nodes and animated them on, adding arrow heads and understanding the context of each target node’s anchor point. Lastly, I attached local assets that matched up with a database so that users could select any one of the available assets within the tool, including icons, PDFs, case studies, demo videos and more.

text.content: For 2023 I decided to revamp my professional portfolio website to better focus on my core skillset and offerings, while also making a new home to showcase recent creative programming projects. My old website focused on my full-stack capabilities - and while extensive, it didn’t highlight some of the creative front end work that I enjoyed the most.

text.content: Early in the process I decided I wanted to use a WebGL hero section, so that I could have it be visually intriguing while also maintaining a consistently high frame rate. I started working on this using ShaderToy, to quickly visualize the flowing effect I was going for. After tinkering with different ideas for some time, I landed on something that felt like it would make for a solid new brand.

text.content: For the portfolio I wanted to show video snippets of the work in action if possible, considering so much of what I do involves motion. Each case study features a 30-second video of the project, which are delivered to the browser in both WebM and MP4 format, with only the selected project autoplaying to reduce CPU load.

rich_text.plain_text: For the portfolio I wanted to show video snippets of the work in action if possible, considering so much of what I do involves motion. Each case study features a 30-second video of the project, which are delivered to the browser in both WebM and MP4 format, with only the selected project autoplaying to reduce CPU load.

rich_text.plain_text: (with inertial physics)

text.content: Editing content is a breeze.

caption.plain_text: Editing content is a breeze.

text.content: A database within Notion makes editing content fast and predictable, and passes along user-defined sort order. I can literally write case studies with drag-and-drop multimedia as easily as if I were writing a blog post or an email.

rich_text.plain_text: A database within Notion makes editing content fast and predictable, and passes along user-defined sort order. I can literally write case studies with drag-and-drop multimedia as easily as if I were writing a blog post or an email.

text.content: The one downside with Notion is that the API performance wasn’t great when reading in multiple case studies in bulk - so I stood up my own API service at

rich_text.plain_text: The one downside with Notion is that the API performance wasn’t great when reading in multiple case studies in bulk - so I stood up my own API service at

text.content: api.marchantweb.com

rich_text.plain_text: api.marchantweb.com

text.content: on Heroku to act as a middleware layer. This approach protected my Notion API keys, cached content in-memory for millisecond-level responses, and served the content from my own domain to achieve all the benefits of the DNS layer.

rich_text.plain_text: on Heroku to act as a middleware layer. This approach protected my Notion API keys, cached content in-memory for millisecond-level responses, and served the content from my own domain to achieve all the benefits of the DNS layer.

text.content: While I don’t go chasing Lighthouse speed tests, this was nice to see.

caption.plain_text: While I don’t go chasing Lighthouse speed tests, this was nice to see.

text.content: To ensure that images and video load at lightning fast speeds, they are automatically downloaded from the Notion API and transcoded/resized by Cloudinary to fit the exact usage on the site. Those requests are then proxied through an API endpoint on the

rich_text.plain_text: To ensure that images and video load at lightning fast speeds, they are automatically downloaded from the Notion API and transcoded/resized by Cloudinary to fit the exact usage on the site. Those requests are then proxied through an API endpoint on the

rich_text.plain_text: (and ergo, to Cloudinary)

text.content: and efficient long-term browser and edge caching policies ensure that media is served as close to the end user at possible.

rich_text.plain_text: and efficient long-term browser and edge caching policies ensure that media is served as close to the end user at possible.

title: Library App
lead: This project was made to fulfill the final project of one of the Courses.

text.content: In this physics-based open-world desktop game you play as a Dodecahedron, a twelve-sided convex polyhedron. The aim of the game is to "level up" by moving your Dodecahedron to the next milestone. The catch? There are no mouse or keyboard controls - you can only interact through API requests.

rich_text.plain_text: In this physics-based open-world desktop game you play as a Dodecahedron, a twelve-sided convex polyhedron. The aim of the game is to "level up" by moving your Dodecahedron to the next milestone. The catch? There are no mouse or keyboard controls - you can only interact through API requests.

Once that was in place, I used Electron’s IPC communication flow to capture API requests and pipe then through to the renderer, where ThreeJS could listen and apply physics updates accordingly.

rich_text.plain_text: and getting the convex physics body of that to collide correctly with the concave terrain and other objects. Once that was in place, I used Electron’s IPC communication flow to capture API requests and pipe then through to the renderer, where ThreeJS could listen and apply physics updates accordingly.

text.content: A slide-in side panel that displayed object properties and recent API requests made against it.

caption.plain_text: A slide-in side panel that displayed object properties and recent API requests made against it.

text.content: The terrain was partly procedural, but with artistic direction provided by an input heightmap. The heightmap file was pixel-mapped in from a PNG file, and then each local area was split into “chunks”, and dynamically loaded at runtime to support large, sprawling landscapes. With this approach, mountains and valleys could be painted in.

rich_text.plain_text: The terrain was partly procedural, but with artistic direction provided by an input heightmap. The heightmap file was pixel-mapped in from a PNG file, and then each local area was split into “chunks”, and dynamically loaded at runtime to support large, sprawling landscapes. With this approach, mountains and valleys could be painted in.

text.content: A LOD (level-of-detail) approach was developed, to only load every

rich_text.plain_text: A LOD (level-of-detail) approach was developed, to only load every

text.content: n

rich_text.plain_text: n

text.content: to keep overall performance snappy while having a detailed, distant horizon.

rich_text.plain_text: to keep overall performance snappy while having a detailed, distant horizon.

text.content: In the screenshot above you can see a series of topographical lines on the terrain at each level of

text.content: “height”

rich_text.plain_text: “height”

text.content: . This was due to the pixel depth of the input file, that could only stretch so far vertically using luminance as a height value. I originally planned to smooth this out procedurally, but actually ended up keeping the effect, as the physics body worked better when the dodecahedron’s flat sides had levels of flat ground to collide with. This is similar to why I went with a dodecahedron in the first place, and not a sphere - to have the object’s natural shape resist continued motion, making it more challenging to get around.

rich_text.plain_text: . This was due to the pixel depth of the input file, that could only stretch so far vertically using luminance as a height value. I originally planned to smooth this out procedurally, but actually ended up keeping the effect, as the physics body worked better when the dodecahedron’s flat sides had levels of flat ground to collide with. This is similar to why I went with a dodecahedron in the first place, and not a sphere - to have the object’s natural shape resist continued motion, making it more challenging to get around.

text.content: I wanted to experiment with the idea and perhaps use it as a teaching tool in the future, or as a proof-of-concept for interacting with a self-hosted API server within an Electron app. Several of the creative techniques developed for Dodecahedron have been utilized in recent commercial projects since putting it down.

title: Inventory Control System
lead: This project was created to train me to be able to make user interface designs in a relatively short amount of time.

text.content: After an exhaustive review, I worked alongside the management team to scope out the process by which we'd not only rebuild the entire application from the ground-up, but in the process we identified a need to also overhaul the user experience; designing a new website that better promotes the high-quality content they publish every day.

rich_text.plain_text: After an exhaustive review, I worked alongside the management team to scope out the process by which we'd not only rebuild the entire application from the ground-up, but in the process we identified a need to also overhaul the user experience; designing a new website that better promotes the high-quality content they publish every day.

text.content: We designed, built and carefully migrated terabytes of data to a brand new web application architecture; significantly improving site performance, user experience and platform management.

rich_text.plain_text: We designed, built and carefully migrated terabytes of data to a brand new web application architecture; significantly improving site performance, user experience and platform management.

text.content: We built an exhaustive design system to cover every use case within Adobe XD.

caption.plain_text: We built an exhaustive design system to cover every use case within Adobe XD.

text.content: We started with 2-week sprint of UX design concepts, exploring different approaches and how the experience may vary based on whether a user was logged in or not, or whether they were a paying subscriber or not. Elements that were designed within Adobe XD included not only page designs and states, but creative components such as content cards, scrollable feeds, and social-media sharing functionality that added a level of micro-interaction.

rich_text.plain_text: We started with 2-week sprint of UX design concepts, exploring different approaches and how the experience may vary based on whether a user was logged in or not, or whether they were a paying subscriber or not. Elements that were designed within Adobe XD included not only page designs and states, but creative components such as content cards, scrollable feeds, and social-media sharing functionality that added a level of micro-interaction.

text.content: With UX locked in place, we moved into the second biggest hurdle, recreating the entire application from scratch. It was built upon WordPress as a completely custom theme, featuring a HTML5/CSS3

rich_text.plain_text: With UX locked in place, we moved into the second biggest hurdle, recreating the entire application from scratch. It was built upon WordPress as a completely custom theme, featuring a HTML5/CSS3

text.content: per page. The entire website, despite now being media-heavy, feels snappy no matter how deep you dive into their content. Within 2 weeks of launch, we saw 2M+ hits to the website with no slowdown whatsoever, and over 80% of the content being delivered from cached edge points.

text.content: With the new website in place ImpactAlpha has been empowered to take bigger steps towards growth and user acquisition, and their users get a much better experience. Conversion rates increased, along with retention and engagement across the board. I’ve since handed the project over to ImpactAlpha’s internal developers to take over; knowing they can do so from a solid foundation.

title: E-Commerce
lead: This project was created to train me to be more reliable in making beautiful UI designs.

text.content: Red Arcade, a gaming channel, was in need of a website that represented their brand and allowed for efficient and flexible clip submission. They had a high volume of video clips and their old website was not up to the standards. I partnered with Olaf Uhre

rich_text.plain_text: Red Arcade, a gaming channel, was in need of a website that represented their brand and allowed for efficient and flexible clip submission. They had a high volume of video clips and their old website was not up to the standards. I partnered with Olaf Uhre

text.content: (founder of RedArcade)

rich_text.plain_text: (founder of RedArcade)

text.content: to build a custom WordPress theme that brought their creative design to life.

rich_text.plain_text: to build a custom WordPress theme that brought their creative design to life.

text.content: To make the clip submission process efficient and flexible for RedArcade’s community of contributers, a Vue-based multi-step submission form was implemented. Drag-and-drop functionality for file uploads was added, along with helpful validation along the way, making the process very mobile friendly.

rich_text.plain_text: To make the clip submission process efficient and flexible for RedArcade’s community of contributers, a Vue-based multi-step submission form was implemented. Drag-and-drop functionality for file uploads was added, along with helpful validation along the way, making the process very mobile friendly.

text.content: The upload component features drag-and-drop, per-clip status and errors, and validation.

caption.plain_text: The upload component features drag-and-drop, per-clip status and errors, and validation.

text.content: On the back-end, all the data was connected and a system was set up for the automatic transfer of clip submissions to both an AirTable account and a MySQL database, for the team to review and incorporate into future videos.

rich_text.plain_text: On the back-end, all the data was connected and a system was set up for the automatic transfer of clip submissions to both an AirTable account and a MySQL database, for the team to review and incorporate into future videos.

text.content: To help visualize the scale of the channel, a Google Cloud application was used to pull in read-only YouTube analytics data and aggregate playlist statistics across all videos. Custom code was written to parse the YouTube API and collect statistics on viewership, such as age groups, gender, country, and device type.

rich_text.plain_text: To help visualize the scale of the channel, a Google Cloud application was used to pull in read-only YouTube analytics data and aggregate playlist statistics across all videos. Custom code was written to parse the YouTube API and collect statistics on viewership, such as age groups, gender, country, and device type.

text.content: Playlists had their metrics aggregated to get broader viewership counts such as total views, and how many minutes have been watched within the last calendar year. Lastly, we pull in the latest videos from the channel daily to feature on both the homepage and the about page.

rich_text.plain_text: Playlists had their metrics aggregated to get broader viewership counts such as total views, and how many minutes have been watched within the last calendar year. Lastly, we pull in the latest videos from the channel daily to feature on both the homepage and the about page.

text.content: Statistics were aggregated per various demographic buckets, and are updated automatically on a regular basis.

caption.plain_text: Statistics were aggregated per various demographic buckets, and are updated automatically on a regular basis.

text.content: Some recent statistics include:

rich_text.plain_text: Some recent statistics include:

text.content: The channel has nearly 5M subscribers on YouTube.

rich_text.plain_text: The channel has nearly 5M subscribers on YouTube.

text.content: Most video uploads see an average of 2.2M views.

rich_text.plain_text: Most video uploads see an average of 2.2M views.

text.content: 1.9+ billion minutes of video content was watched in 2022

rich_text.plain_text: 1.9+ billion minutes of video content was watched in 2022

text.content: (that’s 3,500+ years!)

rich_text.plain_text: (that’s 3,500+ years!)

text.content: The process of creating this website was complex but the end result was worth it. It required a lot of attention to detail to make sure the website was secure, performant, flexible, and visually impressive. From choosing the right frameworks and libraries, to making sure the website was mobile friendly and to integrating the necessary data - every detail had to be considered and implemented correctly.

rich_text.plain_text: The process of creating this website was complex but the end result was worth it. It required a lot of attention to detail to make sure the website was secure, performant, flexible, and visually impressive. From choosing the right frameworks and libraries, to making sure the website was mobile friendly and to integrating the necessary data - every detail had to be considered and implemented correctly.

text.content: The outcome of this project was a website that captures Red Arcade's brand and highlights their gaming channel in the best possible way. Now, Red Arcade has a secure, efficient, and visually impressive platform to showcase their gaming content. Since the launch in 2019, very little maintenance has been needed on the website, as it uses minimal plugins in favor of building functionality into the theme. Even aggregated statistics roll over from year-to-year, and featured content is entirely configurable from within the CMS without a need to touch any code.

rich_text.plain_text: The outcome of this project was a website that captures Red Arcade's brand and highlights their gaming channel in the best possible way. Now, Red Arcade has a secure, efficient, and visually impressive platform to showcase their gaming content. Since the launch in 2019, very little maintenance has been needed on the website, as it uses minimal plugins in favor of building functionality into the theme. Even aggregated statistics roll over from year-to-year, and featured content is entirely configurable from within the CMS without a need to touch any code.

text.content: Simon did an amazing job and figured out how to make everything work like charm. He's easy to work with and knows his stuff very well. Highly recommend!

title: Google Cambridge Events
lead: “From landing humans on the moon and organizing the world’s information, to generative graphics and digital music, code enables us to communicate with machines so that they might respond with amazing utility and sublime artistic creation.”

text.content: This project was a creative installation for Google’s new building in Cambridge, Boston. The theme of the installation is

rich_text.plain_text: This project was a creative installation for Google’s new building in Cambridge, Boston. The theme of the installation is

text.content: “Code is Poetry”

rich_text.plain_text: “Code is Poetry”

text.content: , celebrating the creative beauty of programming and honoring the impact of code on real lives.

rich_text.plain_text: , celebrating the creative beauty of programming and honoring the impact of code on real lives.

text.content: Poetry fills many digital canvases along the 16th floor elevator lobby.

caption.plain_text: Poetry fills many digital canvases along the 16th floor elevator lobby.

text.content: The installation consists of three core components: a wayfinding layer, an expression layer, and architectural lighting. Above that sits a layer of data management that minimizes the burden of authorship to create beautiful, content-responsive wayfinding along visitor journeys to different spaces.

rich_text.plain_text: The installation consists of three core components: a wayfinding layer, an expression layer, and architectural lighting. Above that sits a layer of data management that minimizes the burden of authorship to create beautiful, content-responsive wayfinding along visitor journeys to different spaces.

text.content: The wayfinding system responds in realtime using socket connections to Google’s proprietary CMS, where each digital canvas determines what data to show - everything from short info blurbs to full event agendas/details, and animated maps. Content authors can upload logos, manage color schemes, and even launch completely branded takeovers of larger screens.

rich_text.plain_text: The wayfinding system responds in realtime using socket connections to Google’s proprietary CMS, where each digital canvas determines what data to show - everything from short info blurbs to full event agendas/details, and animated maps. Content authors can upload logos, manage color schemes, and even launch completely branded takeovers of larger screens.

text.content: The 3rd floor has a different look, with a cooler color palette.

caption.plain_text: The 3rd floor has a different look, with a cooler color palette.

text.content: While wayfinding points you in the right direction, the expression layer

rich_text.plain_text: While wayfinding points you in the right direction, the expression layer

text.content: (digital artwork)

rich_text.plain_text: (digital artwork)

text.content: writes historic code snippets to the screen and then creatively transforms them into procedurally-generated poetry.

rich_text.plain_text: writes historic code snippets to the screen and then creatively transforms them into procedurally-generated poetry.

text.content: Every few minutes we cycle through different code and output poetry, creating a truly unique experience on every view. The effect is entrancing, and the subtle animations and blending between the expression layer and the wayfinding catch your eye as you enjoy the space.

rich_text.plain_text: Every few minutes we cycle through different code and output poetry, creating a truly unique experience on every view. The effect is entrancing, and the subtle animations and blending between the expression layer and the wayfinding catch your eye as you enjoy the space.

text.content: A floor-to-ceiling media wall fills your field of view as you exit the 3rd floor elevator lobby.

caption.plain_text: A floor-to-ceiling media wall fills your field of view as you exit the 3rd floor elevator lobby.

text.content: RGB architectural lighting nodes integrated throughout the overhead ceiling architecture work in concert with the the signage system to create a wholistic visitor experience. Coloring and micro-animations relating to the on-screen content create gentle currents of movement to reinforce the directional wayfinding.

rich_text.plain_text: RGB architectural lighting nodes integrated throughout the overhead ceiling architecture work in concert with the the signage system to create a wholistic visitor experience. Coloring and micro-animations relating to the on-screen content create gentle currents of movement to reinforce the directional wayfinding.

text.content: The two different floors presented two entirely different lighting scenarios. One is a series of tracks in a spiralling run above your head, whereas the other is a series of lit panels along the walls, encompassing the entire space. These different scenarios were able to use the same codebase, being parametized to create vastly different effects in a manageable and maintainable way.

rich_text.plain_text: The two different floors presented two entirely different lighting scenarios. One is a series of tracks in a spiralling run above your head, whereas the other is a series of lit panels along the walls, encompassing the entire space. These different scenarios were able to use the same codebase, being parametized to create vastly different effects in a manageable and maintainable way.

text.content: Ring lights engage with the content system outside the 16th floor tech talk space.

caption.plain_text: Ring lights engage with the content system outside the 16th floor tech talk space.

text.content: . To avoid abrupt cuts for structural changes, we always let the current animation gracefully exit before starting a new timeline with the updated data.
